content.body: I heard `import defer * as ns` has changed to `import defer ns` is that happening?
content.formatted_body: I heard import defer * as ns has changed to import defer ns is that happening?

content.body: No, where did you read it?
littledan: syntax for meta.resolve() or a different attribute makes a bit more sense to me than overloading `type`
content.formatted_body: littledan: syntax for meta.resolve() or a different attribute makes a bit more sense to me than overloading type

content.body: littledan: at least as currently specified we end up fetching everything with `type` and this `url` thing would create quite the code smell I think
content.formatted_body: littledan: at least as currently specified we end up fetching everything with type and this url thing would create quite the code smell I think

content.body: I don't remember us discussing overloading `type` much in this group. I agree that it's code smell to use that particular attribute. I'd at least use another key
content.formatted_body: I don't remember us discussing overloading type much in this group. I agree that it's code smell to use that particular attribute. I'd at least use another key

content.body: We've mostly discussed syntax like `import asset foo from "./foo.jpeg";` or something
content.formatted_body: We've mostly discussed syntax like import asset foo from "./foo.jpeg"; or something

content.body: Kris didn't like that syntax because he found it ambiguous between whether `foo` was a URL or the bytes
content.formatted_body: Kris didn't like that syntax because he found it ambiguous between whether foo was a URL or the bytes

content.body: even if it's the bytes: we still need the type so that the fetch can be done properly
